we.0: This Privacy Notice describes how the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals ("ASPCA", "we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, shares, and protects your personal information. This Privacy Notice applies to any and all websites, mobile applications, and other digital products or services that link to this Privacy Notice, as well as our social media, emails, and communications with you (collectively, the "Services").

we.4: How We Protect and Store Information

we.6: a.      Information You Give The ASPCA. When you interact with the Services, we may collect the following information from you:

we.7: Feedback information: This includes information you provide in response to questions or surveys we may send you through the Services, including for feedback and research purposes.

we.8: Some of this information may be collected by external parties on our behalf. For example, we use a payment processor when you may conduct a transaction through the Services. The ASPCA does not itself collect or store payment card information.

we.9: Much of this information is collected through cookies, which may be operated by our partners who assist us in collecting information about usage of the Services, targeted advertising, or providing other services to you. While we do not share your information for monetary value with these partners, the engagement of these partners may be considered a “sale” of your information.

we.10: For example, we use Google Analytics to conduct analytics and collect usage details. You can learn more about Google Analytics here, and opt out of collection of your information by using the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. We also use Google Ads and Facebook Pixel to customize our advertising and to serve you ads based on your browsing behavior. These partners use cookies to serve you ads based on your prior visits to our Services and other websites on the internet. These cookies allow your behavior to be tracked after you have been redirected to our Services by clicking on an ad. You can learn more about Google Ads here and Facebook here. You can opt-out of personalized advertising through Google's Ad Settings and Facebook's Ad Settings. You can also clear and control the information third parties share with Facebook in your Off-Facebook Activity page.

we.11: These partners may be able to identify your email address via cookies and combine it with other information they have access to, such as your mailing address, so we can send you information we feel may be of interest to you.

we.12: Please note we use other cookies set by other third-party partners for the above-described purposes. You may be able to opt out of tracking by cookies or control how information collected by cookies is being used via a number of means, as described in General Privacy Choices.

we.14: Marketing: Send you information, recommendations, and events we feel may be of interest to you, administer surveys, and tailor the content we display to you on the Services and communications, including advertising.

we.16: With service providers that we believe need the information to perform a technology, business, or other professional function for us such as payment processing, IT services, maintenance and hosting of our Services, marketing, accounting, auditing, tax services, and other professional services.

we.17: With third parties whose products, services, or offerings may be of interest to you. The ASPCA may share, rent, or sell your email or mailing address with third parties that we believe engage in activities that may be of interest to you. You can opt-out of this sharing by following the instructions in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. No mobile information will be shared with third parties, including affiliates, for marketing or promotional purposes. This sharing excludes text messaging originator opt-in data and consent, and this information will not be shared with any third parties.

we.18: When required by law and when we are legally required to do so, such as in response to or in compliance with court or regulatory agency orders, legal proceedings, or legal process, to exercise our legal rights, to defend against legal claims or demands, or to comply with the requirements of any applicable law.

we.19: To prevent harm or if we believe it is necessary in order to detect, investigate, prevent, or take action against illegal activities, fraud, or situations involving potential threats to the rights, property, or personal safety of any person.

we.20: As part of a business transaction with another entity or its affiliates or service providers in connection with a contemplated or actual merger, acquisition, consolidation, change of control, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, or if we undergo bankruptcy or liquidation. We cannot promise that an acquiring party or the merged entity will have the same privacy practices or treat your information the same as described in this Privacy Notice.

we.21: 4.      HOW WE PROTECT AND STORE INFORMATION

we.22: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

we.23: As an ASPCA donor, you may submit a request to review the information we maintain on you and request corrections if the information is inaccurate. You may also submit a request to opt-out of your contact information (name, mailing address, email address) being sold to or shared with third parties for marketing purposes. To submit a request, please contact the ASPCA at the below email, telephone number, address.

we.24: To ensure we can process your request in a timely manner, please include your full name, physical address, and email address.

we.25: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

we.26: Your browser or device may include “Do Not Track” functionality. Because definitions and rules for a “Do Not Track” standard have not yet been established, including whether such signals must be user-enabled, we do not yet respond to “Do Not Track” signals sent from browsers.

we.27: Colorado residents have the right to access, delete, and correct certain information we collect about them, as well as the right to opt-out of targeted advertising and the “sale” of their information. We do not use your information for profiling purposes for which the right to opt-out applies.

we.28: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

we.29: We do not knowingly or intentionally gather personal information about children. If we have inadvertently collected the personal information of a child under 18, or equivalent minimum age depending on jurisdiction, a parent or guardian of that child may contact us at solicitations@aspca.org to request that we delete the information from our records or otherwise cease the use of that information in accordance with applicable law

we.30: We may make changes to this Privacy Notice from time to time. The “Effective Date” at the top of this page indicates when this Privacy Notice was last revised. We may also notify you in other ways from time to time about the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information described in this Privacy Notice.

promise.0: As part of a business transaction with another entity or its affiliates or service providers in connection with a contemplated or actual merger, acquisition, consolidation, change of control, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, or if we undergo bankruptcy or liquidation. We cannot promise that an acquiring party or the merged entity will have the same privacy practices or treat your information the same as described in this Privacy Notice.

information.0: This Privacy Notice describes how the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals ("ASPCA", "we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, shares, and protects your personal information. This Privacy Notice applies to any and all websites, mobile applications, and other digital products or services that link to this Privacy Notice, as well as our social media, emails, and communications with you (collectively, the "Services").

information.4: Contact information: This includes your name, email address, postal address, telephone number, and any other information you choose to include interact with us, such as when you make a donation, request information, or subscribe to ASPCA updates or publications.

information.5: Account information: Depending on the type of account you create, this may include your name, email address, telephone number, physical address, Employer Identification Number, license number, occupation, and usage preferences.

information.6: Transactional information: If you make a donation or purchase, this includes your name, email address, payment card information, and billing address.

information.7: Customer service interactions: This includes information you provide when you engage with our customer service, including through recorded telephone calls, surveys, and email correspondence.

information.8: Feedback information: This includes information you provide in response to questions or surveys we may send you through the Services, including for feedback and research purposes.

information.10: Some of this information may be collected by external parties on our behalf. For example, we use a payment processor when you may conduct a transaction through the Services. The ASPCA does not itself collect or store payment card information.

information.11: Information The ASPCA Learns From Your Use of the Services.

information.12: Device information, including the IP address and other details of a device that you use to connect with our Services, such as device type and unique device identifier, hardware model, operating system, browser, mobile network information, mobile carrier, and the device's telephone number.

information.13: Location information where you choose to provide us with access to information about your device’s location.

information.14: Much of this information is collected through cookies, which may be operated by our partners who assist us in collecting information about usage of the Services, targeted advertising, or providing other services to you. While we do not share your information for monetary value with these partners, the engagement of these partners may be considered a “sale” of your information.

information.15: For example, we use Google Analytics to conduct analytics and collect usage details. You can learn more about Google Analytics here, and opt out of collection of your information by using the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. We also use Google Ads and Facebook Pixel to customize our advertising and to serve you ads based on your browsing behavior. These partners use cookies to serve you ads based on your prior visits to our Services and other websites on the internet. These cookies allow your behavior to be tracked after you have been redirected to our Services by clicking on an ad. You can learn more about Google Ads here and Facebook here. You can opt-out of personalized advertising through Google's Ad Settings and Facebook's Ad Settings. You can also clear and control the information third parties share with Facebook in your Off-Facebook Activity page.

information.16: These partners may be able to identify your email address via cookies and combine it with other information they have access to, such as your mailing address, so we can send you information we feel may be of interest to you.

information.17: Please note we use other cookies set by other third-party partners for the above-described purposes. You may be able to opt out of tracking by cookies or control how information collected by cookies is being used via a number of means, as described in General Privacy Choices.

information.18: Information about the marketing and advertisements you have seen and clicked on,

information.19: Your email address and other contact information, from third parties that share similar missions or which whom the ASPCA partners for events, projects, or goals.

information.20: The ASPCA may use your information for any of the following purposes:

information.21: Marketing: Send you information, recommendations, and events we feel may be of interest to you, administer surveys, and tailor the content we display to you on the Services and communications, including advertising.

information.22: The ASPCA may also use and share in an aggregate or de-identified manner information at our discretion, including for research, analysis, marketing, and improvement of the Services.

information.23: The ASPCA may share information as follows:

information.24: With service providers that we believe need the information to perform a technology, business, or other professional function for us such as payment processing, IT services, maintenance and hosting of our Services, marketing, accounting, auditing, tax services, and other professional services.

information.25: With advertising and measurement partners who assist us in serving advertisements regarding the Services to others who may be interested in the Services, or who use cookies to display interest-based advertising to you on the Services. These third parties use tracking technologies on the Services to collect or receive information from the Services and elsewhere on the internet and use that information to provide measurement services and target ads. Third parties may allow other companies to access information about you so that they may market other products you may be interested in.

information.26: With third parties whose products, services, or offerings may be of interest to you. The ASPCA may share, rent, or sell your email or mailing address with third parties that we believe engage in activities that may be of interest to you. You can opt-out of this sharing by following the instructions in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. No mobile information will be shared with third parties, including affiliates, for marketing or promotional purposes. This sharing excludes text messaging originator opt-in data and consent, and this information will not be shared with any third parties.

information.27: As part of a business transaction with another entity or its affiliates or service providers in connection with a contemplated or actual merger, acquisition, consolidation, change of control, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, or if we undergo bankruptcy or liquidation. We cannot promise that an acquiring party or the merged entity will have the same privacy practices or treat your information the same as described in this Privacy Notice.

information.28: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

information.29: As an ASPCA donor, you may submit a request to review the information we maintain on you and request corrections if the information is inaccurate. You may also submit a request to opt-out of your contact information (name, mailing address, email address) being sold to or shared with third parties for marketing purposes. To submit a request, please contact the ASPCA at the below email, telephone number, address.

information.30: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

information.31: Update and view your account information:

information.32: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

information.33: You can visit the Network Advertising Initiative or the Digital Advertising Alliance to learn more about your options for opting out of the use of your information by certain companies to deliver interest-based advertising.

information.34: California's "Shine the Light" law permits individuals in California to request certain details about how certain types of their information are shared with third parties for those third parties' own direct marketing purposes. If you are a California resident, you may opt-out of such sharing by emailing us at solicitations@aspca.org.

information.35: Colorado residents have the right to access, delete, and correct certain information we collect about them, as well as the right to opt-out of targeted advertising and the “sale” of their information. We do not use your information for profiling purposes for which the right to opt-out applies.

information.36: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

information.37: Residents of the State of Nevada have the right to opt out of the sale of certain pieces of their information to third parties who will sell or license their information to others. If you are a Nevada resident and would like to make such a request, please email solitications@aspca.org.

information.38: We do not knowingly or intentionally gather personal information about children. If we have inadvertently collected the personal information of a child under 18, or equivalent minimum age depending on jurisdiction, a parent or guardian of that child may contact us at solicitations@aspca.org to request that we delete the information from our records or otherwise cease the use of that information in accordance with applicable law

information.39: We may make changes to this Privacy Notice from time to time. The “Effective Date” at the top of this page indicates when this Privacy Notice was last revised. We may also notify you in other ways from time to time about the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information described in this Privacy Notice.

use.1: Some of this information may be collected by external parties on our behalf. For example, we use a payment processor when you may conduct a transaction through the Services. The ASPCA does not itself collect or store payment card information.

use.3: Device information, including the IP address and other details of a device that you use to connect with our Services, such as device type and unique device identifier, hardware model, operating system, browser, mobile network information, mobile carrier, and the device's telephone number.

use.7: The ASPCA may use your information for any of the following purposes:

use.8: Offer and maintain the Services: Monitor the performance of the Services, ensure the security of the Services, personalize your experience, and conduct analytics on your use of the Services.

use.9: The ASPCA may also use and share in an aggregate or de-identified manner information at our discretion, including for research, analysis, marketing, and improvement of the Services.

use.10: With advertising and measurement partners who assist us in serving advertisements regarding the Services to others who may be interested in the Services, or who use cookies to display interest-based advertising to you on the Services. These third parties use tracking technologies on the Services to collect or receive information from the Services and elsewhere on the internet and use that information to provide measurement services and target ads. use.11: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. use.12: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

use.13: You can opt-out or set preferences regarding cookies as described in this section. Please note you will need to set preferences on each device you use to visit the Services.

use.14: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

use.15: You can visit the Network Advertising Initiative or the Digital Advertising Alliance to learn more about your options for opting out of the use of your information by certain companies to deliver interest-based advertising.

use.18: We do not knowingly or intentionally gather personal information about children. We may also notify you in other ways from time to time about the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information described in this Privacy Notice.

if.6: Update your marketing preferences: If you no longer wish to receive marketing communications from us, you can click the unsubscribe link at the bottom of any email from us. If you no longer with you receive automated marketing text messages, you can opt-out by responding to any of our text messages with STOP.

if.12: If you have any questions about this Privacy Notice, please contact the ASPCA at:

when.0: a.      Information You Give The ASPCA. When you interact with the Services, we may collect the following information from you:

when.1: Contact information: This includes your name, email address, postal address, telephone number, and any other information you choose to include interact with us, such as when you make a donation, request information, or subscribe to ASPCA updates or publications.

when.2: Customer service interactions: This includes information you provide when you engage with our customer service, including through recorded telephone calls, surveys, and email correspondence.

when.3: Some of this information may be collected by external parties on our behalf. For example, we use a payment processor when you may conduct a transaction through the Services. The ASPCA does not itself collect or store payment card information.

when.4: b.      Information The ASPCA Learns From Your Use of the Services. When you interact with our Services, certain information about you is automatically collected via cookies and similar technologies (referred to collectively herein as "cookies"). Cookies are small text files that are stored within your device's memory by a website. Cookies enable a website such as ours to keep track of your activities to improve user experience, advertise our Services, and ensure the security of our Services. As you use our Services, the following information is automatically collected from you:

when.6: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

when.7: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

when.8: We may make changes to this Privacy Notice from time to time. The “Effective Date” at the top of this page indicates when this Privacy Notice was last revised. We may also notify you in other ways from time to time about the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information described in this Privacy Notice.

help.1: Help the ASPCA Put a Stop to Animal Cruelty

help.2:
By providing my mobile number, I agree to receive 2-4 text messages per month from the ASPCA, which may include requests for charitable donations. Text STOP to opt-out, HELP for more info. Message and data rates may apply. 
Terms & Conditions / Privacy Policy

access.0: Usage details about your interaction with our Services, such as which pages you access, frequency of access, what you click on, search terms, date and length of visits, and referring website addresses.

access.1: Location information where you choose to provide us with access to information about your device’s location.

access.2: These partners may be able to identify your email address via cookies and combine it with other information they have access to, such as your mailing address, so we can send you information we feel may be of interest to you.

access.3: With advertising and measurement partners who assist us in serving advertisements regarding the Services to others who may be interested in the Services, or who use cookies to display interest-based advertising to you on the Services. These third parties use tracking technologies on the Services to collect or receive information from the Services and elsewhere on the internet and use that information to provide measurement services and target ads. Third parties may allow other companies to access information about you so that they may market other products you may be interested in.

access.4: Update and view your account information: You can access your ASPCA account at any time to update and view certain information of yours in our possession and which is associated with your account, such as your email address and telephone number.

access.5: Colorado residents have the right to access, delete, and correct certain information we collect about them, as well as the right to opt-out of targeted advertising and the “sale” of their information. We do not use your information for profiling purposes for which the right to opt-out applies.

access.6: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

we collect.0: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

we collect.1: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

we collect.2: Colorado residents have the right to access, delete, and correct certain information we collect about them, as well as the right to opt-out of targeted advertising and the “sale” of their information. We do not use your information for profiling purposes for which the right to opt-out applies.

we may collect.0: a.      Information You Give The ASPCA. When you interact with the Services, we may collect the following information from you:

we may collect.1: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

you may.0: Some of this information may be collected by external parties on our behalf. For example, we use a payment processor when you may conduct a transaction through the Services. The ASPCA does not itself collect or store payment card information.

you may.1: Please note we use other cookies set by other third-party partners for the above-described purposes. You may be able to opt out of tracking by cookies or control how information collected by cookies is being used via a number of means, as described in General Privacy Choices.

you may.2: With advertising and measurement partners who assist us in serving advertisements regarding the Services to others who may be interested in the Services, or who use cookies to display interest-based advertising to you on the Services. These third parties use tracking technologies on the Services to collect or receive information from the Services and elsewhere on the internet and use that information to provide measurement services and target ads. Third parties may allow other companies to access information about you so that they may market other products you may be interested in.

you may.3: As an ASPCA donor, you may submit a request to review the information we maintain on you and request corrections if the information is inaccurate. You may also submit a request to opt-out of your contact information (name, mailing address, email address) being sold to or shared with third parties for marketing purposes. To submit a request, please contact the ASPCA at the below email, telephone number, address.

you may.4: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

you may.5: California's "Shine the Light" law permits individuals in California to request certain details about how certain types of their information are shared with third parties for those third parties' own direct marketing purposes. If you are a California resident, you may opt-out of such sharing by emailing us at solicitations@aspca.org.

you may.6: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

you can.2: For example, we use Google Analytics to conduct analytics and collect usage details. You can learn more about Google Analytics here, and opt out of collection of your information by using the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. We also use Google Ads and Facebook Pixel to customize our advertising and to serve you ads based on your browsing behavior. These partners use cookies to serve you ads based on your prior visits to our Services and other websites on the internet. These cookies allow your behavior to be tracked after you have been redirected to our Services by clicking on an ad. You can learn more about Google Ads here and Facebook here. You can opt-out of personalized advertising through Google's Ad Settings and Facebook's Ad Settings. You can also clear and control the information third parties share with Facebook in your Off-Facebook Activity page.

you can.3: With third parties whose products, services, or offerings may be of interest to you. The ASPCA may share, rent, or sell your email or mailing address with third parties that we believe engage in activities that may be of interest to you. You can opt-out of this sharing by following the instructions in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. No mobile information will be shared with third parties, including affiliates, for marketing or promotional purposes. This sharing excludes text messaging originator opt-in data and consent, and this information will not be shared with any third parties.

you can.4: Update and view your account information: You can access your ASPCA account at any time to update and view certain information of yours in our possession and which is associated with your account, such as your email address and telephone number.

you can.5: Update your marketing preferences: If you no longer wish to receive marketing communications from us, you can click the unsubscribe link at the bottom of any email from us. If you no longer with you receive automated marketing text messages, you can opt-out by responding to any of our text messages with STOP.

you can.6: You can opt-out or set preferences regarding cookies as described in this section. Please note you will need to set preferences on each device you use to visit the Services.

you can.7: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

you can.8: You can visit the Network Advertising Initiative or the Digital Advertising Alliance to learn more about your options for opting out of the use of your information by certain companies to deliver interest-based advertising.

you can.9: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

request.0: Contact information: This includes your name, email address, postal address, telephone number, and any other information you choose to include interact with us, such as when you make a donation, request information, or subscribe to ASPCA updates or publications.

request.1: As an ASPCA donor, you may submit a request to review the information we maintain on you and request corrections if the information is inaccurate. You may also submit a request to opt-out of your contact information (name, mailing address, email address) being sold to or shared with third parties for marketing purposes. To submit a request, please contact the ASPCA at the below email, telephone number, address.

request.2: To ensure we can process your request in a timely manner, please include your full name, physical address, and email address.

request.3: California's "Shine the Light" law permits individuals in California to request certain details about how certain types of their information are shared with third parties for those third parties' own direct marketing purposes. request.5: Residents of the State of Nevada have the right to opt out of the sale of certain pieces of their information to third parties who will sell or license their information to others. If you are a Nevada resident and would like to make such a request, please email solitications@aspca.org.

request.6: We do not knowingly or intentionally gather personal information about children. If we have inadvertently collected the personal information of a child under 18, or equivalent minimum age depending on jurisdiction, a parent or guardian of that child may contact us at solicitations@aspca.org to request that we delete the information from our records or otherwise cease the use of that information in accordance with applicable law

legal.0: Comply with legal and regulatory obligations:

legal.1: When required by law and when we are legally required to do so, such as in response to or in compliance with court or regulatory agency orders, legal proceedings, or legal process, to exercise our legal rights, to defend against legal claims or demands, or to comply with the requirements of any applicable law.

As you use our Services, the following information is automatically collected from you:

security.1: Offer and maintain the Services: Monitor the performance of the Services, ensure the security of the Services, personalize your experience, and conduct analytics on your use of the Services.

security.2: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

security.3: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.

auditing.0: With service providers that we believe need the information to perform a technology, business, or other professional function for us such as payment processing, IT services, maintenance and hosting of our Services, marketing, accounting, auditing, tax services, and other professional services.

how.2: This Privacy Notice describes how the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals ("ASPCA", "we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, shares, and protects your personal information. This Privacy Notice applies to any and all websites, mobile applications, and other digital products or services that link to this Privacy Notice, as well as our social media, emails, and communications with you (collectively, the "Services").

how.5: How We Protect and Store Information

how.6: Please note we use other cookies set by other third-party partners for the above-described purposes. You may be able to opt out of tracking by cookies or control how information collected by cookies is being used via a number of means, as described in General Privacy Choices.

how.9: 4.      HOW WE PROTECT AND STORE INFORMATION

how.10: You may have certain choices when it comes to how we collect and use your information as follows:

how.11: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

how.12: California's "Shine the Light" law permits individuals in California to request certain details about how certain types of their information are shared with third parties for those third parties' own direct marketing purposes. If you are a California resident, you may opt-out of such sharing by emailing us at solicitations@aspca.org.

what.0: Usage details about your interaction with our Services, such as which pages you access, frequency of access, what you click on, search terms, date and length of visits, and referring website addresses.

understand.0: Please note this Privacy Notice does not apply to non-ASPCA websites or services that state they are offered under a different privacy notice. Please review the privacy notices on those websites and services directly to understand their privacy practices.

understand.1: Improve the Services: Grow the ASPCA and our mission, understand the effectiveness of our marketing, events, and other promotional campaigns, and conduct market research and statistical analysis.

understand.2: We use a combination of physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to protect the information we collect through the Services. In particular, our Services have industry standard encryption measures in place to protect personal information and all payment information is transmitted using Secure Socket Layer ("SSL") technology. While we use these precautions to safeguard your information, we cannot guarantee the security of the networks, systems, servers, devices, and databases we operate or that are operated on our behalf. If you use our Services outside of the United States, you understand that we may collect, process, and store your personal information in the United States and other countries.

learn.0: For example, we use Google Analytics to conduct analytics and collect usage details. You can learn more about Google Analytics here, and opt out of collection of your information by using the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. We also use Google Ads and Facebook Pixel to customize our advertising and to serve you ads based on your browsing behavior. These partners use cookies to serve you ads based on your prior visits to our Services and other websites on the internet. These cookies allow your behavior to be tracked after you have been redirected to our Services by clicking on an ad. You can learn more about Google Ads here and Facebook here. You can opt-out of personalized advertising through Google's Ad Settings and Facebook's Ad Settings. You can also clear and control the information third parties share with Facebook in your Off-Facebook Activity page.

learn.1: You can visit the Network Advertising Initiative or the Digital Advertising Alliance to learn more about your options for opting out of the use of your information by certain companies to deliver interest-based advertising.

cookies.0: b.      Information The ASPCA Learns From Your Use of the Services. When you interact with our Services, certain information about you is automatically collected via cookies and similar technologies (referred to collectively herein as "cookies"). Cookies are small text files that are stored within your device's memory by a website. Cookies enable a website such as ours to keep track of your activities to improve user experience, advertise our Services, and ensure the security of our Services. As you use our Services, the following information is automatically collected from you:

cookies.1: Much of this information is collected through cookies, which may be operated by our partners who assist us in collecting information about usage of the Services, targeted advertising, or providing other services to you. While we do not share your information for monetary value with these partners, the engagement of these partners may be considered a “sale” of your information.

cookies.2: For example, we use Google Analytics to conduct analytics and collect usage details. You can learn more about Google Analytics here, and opt out of collection of your information by using the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on. We also use Google Ads and Facebook Pixel to customize our advertising and to serve you ads based on your browsing behavior. These partners use cookies to serve you ads based on your prior visits to our Services and other websites on the internet. These cookies allow your behavior to be tracked after you have been redirected to our Services by clicking on an ad. You can learn more about Google Ads here and Facebook here. You can opt-out of personalized advertising through Google's Ad Settings and Facebook's Ad Settings. You can also clear and control the information third parties share with Facebook in your Off-Facebook Activity page.

cookies.3: These partners may be able to identify your email address via cookies and combine it with other information they have access to, such as your mailing address, so we can send you information we feel may be of interest to you.

cookies.4: Please note we use other cookies set by other third-party partners for the above-described purposes. You may be able to opt out of tracking by cookies or control how information collected by cookies is being used via a number of means, as described in General Privacy Choices.

cookies.5: With advertising and measurement partners who assist us in serving advertisements regarding the Services to others who may be interested in the Services, or who use cookies to display interest-based advertising to you on the Services. These third parties use tracking technologies on the Services to collect or receive information from the Services and elsewhere on the internet and use that information to provide measurement services and target ads. Third parties may allow other companies to access information about you so that they may market other products you may be interested in.

cookies.6: You can opt-out or set preferences regarding cookies as described in this section. Please note you will need to set preferences on each device you use to visit the Services.

cookies.7: You can set your browser to refuse cookies or indicate when a cookie is being sent. Please note that if you do, certain features of the Services may not function properly or be available. If you are visiting the Services from a mobile device, the operating system of the device may offer you options regarding how the device collects and uses your information for interest-based advertising.

cookies.8: You or your authorized agent may submit a request to exercise your right to access, deletion, correction by email.  For your security, we will require you to verify your identity before we can act on your request by providing us with information to match our records. If you are asking to exercise a right on behalf of someone else, we will require verification of your identity, as well as proof of authorization by the individual. To opt-out of targeted advertising or the sale of your information via cookies, please follow the instructions in General Privacy Choices. You can opt-out of the sale of your information for promotional purposes as described in Donor Privacy Choices or by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org. You may appeal our decision with respect to a request you have submitted by emailing us at solitications@aspca.org.
